result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy Jacob Schroeder

records.addlTxt:
1:14 PM Apprs: Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann for S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris,  Defendant Jeremy Jacob Schroeder in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Jeremy Jacob Schroeder.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file.  PD's office was to look into matter to see if DE qualifies for PD.  Atty Schmidt does not have further information regarding PD appointment.  Atty Schmidt requesting to modify bond.  Bond argument.  Court reviews other open files in St. Croix County. Court maintains bond conditions at this time. Court questions Atty Schmidt as to attorney recommendations.  DE to contact PD's office again to go over current job status.  Court schedules next hearing.  Adjourned at 1:20 PM. bph
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on December 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- Comply with terms and conditions of current restraining order

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Angela S..  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

2:01 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: C. Dillon, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Jeremy Jacob Schroeder in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Jeremy Jacob Schroeder.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE confirms address.  DE does not qualify for PD, PFAC given, Atty Satorius would like to follow up with this. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Bond argument.  Court orders bond.  Court schedules next hearing.  Adjourned at 2:05 PM. bph
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:05 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on December 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on November 2, 2022 at 01:05 pm.
